modules.title: Original data from URL (shift + cursor to move the spectra / double click to reset zoom)

modules.richtext:
First, click on "create headers" button to read headers from metadata.

Then select a header from the table and use the "set color" button to color the data according to it.

Finally, select the data in the table for which you want to display the spectra.

 

You can select as many headers as you wish to see in the table. The first selected one will be used to color. (use shift or ctrl for multiple selection)

 

A double click on the spectra area will reset the zoom (sometimes it is necessary to reset it before seeing the spectra if cache is enabled in the browser)

 

The top line show in blue the selected spectra from the dataMatrix object in R, while the red curve shows the original data (url of the jcamp)

 

The bottom lines shows the selected spectra. The first selected spectra appears in blue, while the next will take the color of their group.

 

Beware that depending on the size of the spectra and the number that are selected coloring may take a few seconds.
